snippet: Testing of eggs from chickens in the city’s community gardens often showed lead, the Dining & Wine section reports.
abstract: Testing of eggs from chickens in the city’s community gardens often showed lead, the Dining & Wine section reports.
lead_paragraph: Green-minded New Yorkers boast about the city’s community gardens and the produce they yield. But eggs from the hens that peck in city dirt may contain an unwanted extra ingredient. Preliminary results from a new study done by the state show that more than half of the eggs tested from chickens kept in community gardens in Brooklyn, Bronx and Queens contained lead, unlike their store-bought counterparts. Read the full story in Dining »

headline.main: Study Raises Concern of Safety of Community Gardens’ Eggs
